result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julius A Goodwin

records.addlTxt:
Court reporter Trisch Clark. Defendant Julius A Goodwin in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides in court for Julius A Goodwin.  Attorney Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for a bail/bond hearing as requested by the defense. Victim J.M.S. gives statement in regards to bail motion. State reads in victim statement from M.S. Atty Benavides gives argument. State objects to any modification of bail. Court makes findings and denies the bail motion.
Final pre-trial scheduled for June 5, 2023 at 08:45 am.
Jury selection scheduled for June 12, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for June 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Jury trial on June 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury selection on June 12, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on June 5, 2023 at 08:45 am.
Bail/bond hearing on September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
filed by Atty Benavides

Parties are still working towards a resolution in this case. Parties request a second status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defn's copy for status conference on 8/17/2022 returned. Not deliverable as address/UTF/Return to sender
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on August 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Br 17

12:03 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests cts 1-3 be found transactionally related, DE does not object. Court finds cts 1-3 transactionally related. Det. C. Keller duly sworn, direct and cross. Detective identified Defn in court. State moves for bind over, waives argument and reserves rebuttal. DE objects, waives argument. Court finds PC, case bound over for trial.
Atty Ronald Benavides
Preliminary hearing on June 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Cash bond is set in the amount of $7,500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Tyler L, Janelle S, Marion S, or Lynda T. 
- Defendant shall not be at Club Lamark. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

02:09 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Frank John Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
